timeline.bodyText: Do we need a dedicated RedisConfiguration file every microservice, or could share one file in the /lib folder?
timeline.author: xieus

replies.bodyText: I think it is better to keep it in every microservce because they have different redis-host and redis-post
replies.author: kevin-zhonghao

replies.bodyText: Got it thanks
replies.author: xieus

timeline.bodyText: We should remove this file too.
timeline.author: xieus

replies.bodyText: Sure ~
replies.author: kevin-zhonghao

timeline.bodyText: Suggest to use "createRouteRules"
timeline.author: xieus

replies.bodyText: Yes, this is easier to understand
replies.author: kevin-zhonghao

timeline.bodyText: Why vcResponse = ResourcePersistence?
timeline.author: xieus

replies.bodyText: You might want to throw a more specific exception for the case of "vpc doesn't exist"?
replies.author: xieus

replies.bodyText: At the beginning, I set it to a specific exception because UTs are convenient for testing. Now I make it throw new Exception()
replies.author: kevin-zhonghao

replies.bodyText: a new generic Exception? I don't think you want to do that as you can't tell which block of codes threw the exception.
replies.author: xieus

timeline.bodyText: Which operation will throw ResourceNullException?
timeline.author: xieus

replies.bodyText: There also change to Exception
replies.author: kevin-zhonghao

replies.bodyText: Same rational as above. You want to a specific exception, with better name than "ResourceNullException", maybe "VpcNotExistException"
replies.author: xieus

timeline.bodyText: Do we need to call other microservices here?
timeline.author: xieus

replies.bodyText: I don't think so, I will add a new UT to test it.
replies.author: kevin-zhonghao

replies.bodyText: When a customer updates a subnet, if some resources in the subnet (for example, gateway IP) are changing, we might need to call other microservices to make changes accordingly.
replies.author: xieus

timeline.bodyText: Please add interface for Mac and IP manager. it is time for us to think about it.
timeline.author: xieus

replies.bodyText: No problem
replies.author: kevin-zhonghao

timeline.bodyText: Can you use the same one in /lib folder?
timeline.author: xieus

replies.author: kevin-zhonghao

replies.bodyText: Okay in that case let us keep it as is.
replies.author: xieus

timeline.bodyText: Like the UTs. This is a very good start. Keep going :-)
timeline.author: xieus

replies.bodyText: Thanks so much for your help !
replies.author: kevin-zhonghao

timeline.bodyText: does allFuture.join not include macFuture.join?
timeline.author: xieus

replies.bodyText:
allFuture.join() means sync up all futures (vpc, route, mac), when all above futures are done, this method will be Executed.
macResponse = macFuture.join() means make macResponse value
replies.author: kevin-zhonghao

replies.bodyText: Makes sense. Thanks.
replies.author: xieus

timeline.bodyText: if inSubnetState.getVpcId() is used multiple times, we should use an individual variable to store its value.
timeline.author: xieus
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -86,59 +101,106 @@ public SubnetStateJson createSubnetState(@PathVariable String projectid, @Reques
             RestPreconditionsUtil.verifyResourceFound(inSubnetState.getVpcId());

replies.bodyText: Okay ~
replies.author: kevin-zhonghao

timeline.bodyText: Why is the atomic reference used here?
timeline.author: xieus

replies.bodyText:
This is the way to execute asynchronously， because we can not use MacStateJson directly here (I mean it is in  CompletableFuture.handle() method).
So I use the atomic reference
replies.author: kevin-zhonghao

timeline.bodyText: what would happen if inSubnetState includes some route rules, and we add some more from routeResponse which could be duplicated? Will that create multiple copies of the same rules? like so as we are using List
timeline.author: xieus

replies.bodyText: Can we skip inSubnetState.getRoutes()
replies.author: xieus

replies.bodyText: Yeah, if inSubnetState includes some route rules already, we will just add the rules just created into the list. Do you have any good suggestion?
replies.author: kevin-zhonghao

timeline.bodyText: When Database fails to store the data, actually we will need to roll back the allocated resources as well? What do you think?
timeline.author: xieus

replies.bodyText: Updated as discussed..
replies.author: xieus

timeline.bodyText: Like this! That is the right way to do.
timeline.author: xieus

timeline.bodyText: So fall back will be an sync call?
timeline.author: xieus

replies.bodyText: I can set up fall back as async call ~
replies.author: kevin-zhonghao

timeline.bodyText: What could cause NullPointerException?
timeline.author: xieus

replies.bodyText: This is to prevent that when the call step is executed asynchronously, some responses return null, but this repsonse is used later
replies.author: kevin-zhonghao

timeline.bodyText: Remove the comment if not applicable here.
timeline.author: xieus

replies.bodyText: NP
replies.author: kevin-zhonghao

timeline.bodyText:
We also need to handle FallbackException when the downstream services or db fall back fail.
In that case, we need to log error or critical as well.
timeline.author: xieus

timeline.bodyText:
what do those value (10,20,5000) stand for?
A recommended way is to use "field name: field value".
Also, if possibly, make those value configurable in our application.json file; if not possible, we should make those field as constants and maintain the constants in a separate file.
timeline.author: xieus

replies.bodyText:
corePoolSize:10. maximumPoolSize:20, KeepAliveTime:5000.
I agree with you, I will make those field as constants.
replies.author: kevin-zhonghao

timeline.bodyText:
Looks like we have some fall back UTs. Good job!
Recommend to cover all possible fall back failures.
timeline.author: xieus

replies.bodyText: NP
replies.author: kevin-zhonghao
